content.description:
This is the route to get atop Dorsal Fin for top roping or walk off. Nothing tough except for dodging a tree or two and maybe high stepping a couple times.

At the top of the notch, climb left to access the top of the fin. Watch out for the shiny yellow stuff along a rock edge that must be some type of animal excrement.
content.protection: No pro required, really, though some medium to large cams/hexes with long slings would fit here and there, and you could sling something at the top if you really felt like it.
content.location:
Climb the first crack of the main notch 150' uphill on the east/down canyon side. 5' farther is an even bigger crack/ravine you could climb.

You can also access it from the west side where it's only 3rd class (but the hike up is steeper/looser).

content.description: Follow the line on the right side of the red spot on the whale...I mean wall.  This is all face climbing on nice holds and tiny ledges.  Stay out of and left of the crack/small dihedral on the right.  Follow the line straight up to the large ledge under the Fin.
content.protection: I didn't see much pro on this route, so I TR'ed it. Bolted anchor at the top.

content.description: This is the fourth line on Dorsal Fin (see beta photo).  It starts in the first prominent dihedral.  Follow the dihedral up, placing pro until you get to a small roof.  Set some pro and then up and over you go.  Its still very dirty.  Be careful for loose rock.  Be smart about placing the pro under the roof (check it).  We cleared most the loose stuff; but you never know!!  Roof is the crux.  Keep going until you reach a large ledge just below the top of the fin.  Descent is either walk off the fin (climber right) or set up a rappel.
content.protection: Standard rack. Two-bolt anchor without chains at the top.

content.description: This line is right of the red spot in the small dihedral/crack.  It has a large bush growing out of it about 15 feet up, but you can move onto the face to move past it.  Crux was at the start and middle section; nothing to bad, just some awkward foot placements and handgrips, but you'll figure it out.  Move all the way up until you reach the large ledge below the Fin.  Lots of places to drop pro.
content.protection: Standard rack will get you up. Small cams and medium nuts are solid. Two options for bolted anchors at the top, one over the lip and one just before topping out.

content.description: This route start right next to Gills, but follows the thin cracks on the face to the left of the dihedral.  Continue up this line either through the red spot or staying on the left.  Work up to the roof and then up and over you go.  Couple more moves and then you are on top the large ledge below the top of the fin.  Start and the roof were cruxy for me.
content.protection: Standard rack with small pro mostly. Roof protects very well, just awkward. Bolted anchor at the top.
